 [Martin Genet](https://mgenet.github.io/), [Katerina Skardova](https://m3disim.saclay.inria.fr/people/katerina-skardova/) and I just published two papers in [*Computational Mechanics*](https://link.springer.com/journal/466), entitled 

 * [Finite element neural network interpolation: Part I—interpretable and adaptive discretization for solving PDEs](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00466-025-02677-3), and
 * [Finite element neural network interpolation: Part II—hybridisation with the proper generalised decomposition for non-linear surrogate modelling](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00466-025-02676-4). 

 All computations from the paper (which rely on NeuROM [@daby-seesaramNeuROM2024a]) are easily reproducible at 

* [https://alexandredabyseesaram.github.io/FENNI-I-paper-demo](https://alexandredabyseesaram.github.io/FENNI-I-paper-demo/), and
* [https://alexandredabyseesaram.github.io/FENNI-II-PGD-paper-demo](https://alexandredabyseesaram.github.io/FENNI-II-PGD-paper-demo),

so do not hesitate to give it a try, and let us know how it goes!
